mods.abstract: Portrait of Mary Cora de Garmo (1891-1986) taken at her wedding to Charles W. Bryan (1890-1966) on May 9, 1920. Born on August 28, 1891, Mary was the first child of Frank and Mary Eloise (Donnell) de Garmo. She earned her A.B. (1912) and M.A. (1913) degrees at Washington College and eventually obtained a Ph.D from Cornell University (1931). During her career as a nutritionist, she taught at several educational institutions, edited the "Journal of Home Economics," wrote four books, helped to develop the national school lunch program, and served in a variety of professional organizations. She died in Illinois on May 12, 1986.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections
